private_information: I have a single power feed
My power is available at start
satellite0.goal: Support instrument operations to obtain required images while respecting pointing and power constraints.

instrument0.goal: Be used to capture thermograph0 images for the specified directions as required by the mission goals.

orchestrator.goal: Generate a PDDL domain and problem that models the satellite, instrument, timing, slew and calibration durations, actions (turn, switch_on, switch_off, calibrate, take_image) and the mission goals. Minimize total-time.

public_information: Slew times are symmetric between directions and specified in slew_time
Calibration times per instrument-target pair specified in calibration_time
Each satellite points at exactly one direction when not turning
During a turn the satellite points at no direction
Each satellite has a single power feed shared by its instruments
Switching on takes 2 time units and claims power at start, instrument becomes powered at end and calibration is cleared
Switching off takes 1 time unit and power becomes available at end
Calibration duration given by calibration_time; instrument must be powered throughout and satellite must point at calibration target at start; instrument becomes calibrated at end

Taking an image takes 7 time units and requires instrument powered, calibrated, supporting the mode, and satellite pointing at the image direction throughout; produces have_image(direction,mode) at end
Static relations (instrument on which satellite, supported modes, calibration target) do not change

orchestrator.system_prompt: You are an expert with multi-agent PDDL problems. You will be provided information about the environment and the capabilities and knowledge of the agents which interact in the environment. You always provide a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem file that describes the planning problem. Enclose the pddl domain between <domain></domain> tags, and the pddl problem between <problem></problem> tags. Keep the actions for different agents distinct, so that there is no confusion as to which agent performs which action.
orchestrator.prompt:
Your name is orchestrator.
Initial information about the environment: {environment->init}.
Goal for the environment: {environment->goal}.
The public information is: {environment->public_information}.
The satellite0's constraints are: {agents->agent_details->satellite0->private_information}.
The instrument0's constraints are: {agents->agent_details->instrument0->private_information}.
Think step by step and provide a PDDL domain and problem that encapsulate the integrated model, including objects, initial state, numeric/schedule durations (slew_time and calibration_time), actions (turn, switch_on, switch_off, calibrate, take_image) with start/end and over-all interval conditions and effects, and the mission goals. Respect the constraints of each agent and do not assume information beyond what is provided. Minimize total-time in the produced problem. There is no need for anything else beyond producing the pddl files.
